translation.en: [woman] There is no city on God's green earth that rocks harder than Chicago, Illinois.
translation.ko: 일리노이주 시카고는 이 지구상에서 제일가는 도시예요

translation.en: The legends from this city are so badass,
they only need one name:
translation.ko: 한 번에 묶어 말할 수 있죠

translation.en: Oprah, Ditka, Bozo.
And me, Diane.
You know how they call Chicago the city of broad shoulders?
translation.ko: "시카고" 시카고 별명이 어깨 깡패들의 도시인 거 아세요?

translation.en: Well, I'm the broad.
Just like me, this city has been through some shit,
translation.ko: 이 도시는 저처럼 온갖 산전수전을 다 겪었어요

translation.en: but it always finds a way to bounce back, baby.
Like in 1871,
when the whole damn place burned to the ground.
translation.ko: 엄청난 화재로 온 도시가 잿더미가 됐을 때

translation.en: We didn't cry about it.
We built that bitch right back up.
Then there was Prohibition.
When the country said you can't drink,
translation.ko: 술을 못 마시게 하길래 우린 이렇게 답했어요

translation.en: we said, "Eff dat. Make it a double."
translation.ko: 술을 못 마시게 하길래 우린 이렇게 답했어요 '엿이나 까 잡수쇼! 두 배로 마실 테다'

translation.en: 'Cause in Chicago… [gulps]
…we do things big, baby.
In fact, Chicago does things so big,
our parties are whole frickin' neighborhoods,
and I live in the best one: Wrigleyville.
translation.ko: 전 그중에서도 최고의 동네 리글리빌에 살고 있답니다!

translation.en: Where you can let your hair down,
and when you gotta yak,
there's always someone to hold it back for ya.
Me! And I'm gonna party my tits off!
translation.ko: 바로 나요! 저는 파티를 했다 하면 코가 비뚤어지게 마셔요!

translation.en: [people chanting] Diane! Diane! Diane! Diane!
-[man] Diane! Diane! -Diane! Diane!
[man] Diane! Diane!
-[Diane snores] -Wake up!
[yelps] Damn it, Kurt, you woke me up mid-party dream.
translation.ko: 뭐야, 커트? 꿈에서 한창 파티 중이었단 말이야

translation.en: That's dangerous.
Jesus, Di. I don't know what you got into last night,
translation.ko: 내가 못 살아 어젯밤에 밖에서 뭘 했는지 몰라도

translation.en: but you came home and drank the bottle of brandy
translation.ko: 집에 와서 브랜디 한 병을 다 마시면 어떡해?

translation.en: my dad had with him on D-Day.
Then you forgot to close the window after you had a smoke,
translation.ko: 게다가 당신이 담배 피우고 창문 여는 걸 까먹는 바람에

translation.en: and Butkus almost fell out.
You're not even supposed to have that as a pet.
He was in the Reptile Lost and Found.
Poor guy had 18 condoms of heroin in his little belly.
translation.ko: 헤로인을 가득 넣은 콘돔 18개가 요 작은 배에 들어가 있었다니까

translation.en: Big whoop, we've all been to Mexico.
translation.ko: 요란 떨긴 멕시코 안 가본 사람 있나?

translation.en: Why are you so angry today? You havin' a 'roid flare-up?
translation.ko: 오늘 왜 이렇게 화가 났어? 스테로이드 부작용 도졌어?

translation.en: Diane, yesterday was our anniversary.
Uh, no doy.
That's why I got you…
translation.ko: 그래서 당신한테 주려고 가져온 게 있는데

translation.en: Al's Beef!
You ate it all.
There's a couple of fries in the bag.
I don't want bag fries.
I want my wife to remember the anniversary of the second time we got married.
translation.ko: 난 우리가 두 번째로 결혼한 날을 아내가 기억하길 원할 뿐이라고!

translation.en: Diane, I'm getting too old to live like this.
translation.ko: 다이앤 난 이렇게 살기엔 너무 늙었어

translation.en: Based on my family history and cholesterol level,
translation.ko: 가족력이랑 혈중 콜레스테롤 수치를 봤을 땐

translation.en: I'm gonna die five years ago.
Come on, Kurt, we do this all the time.
translation.ko: 왜 이래, 커트 우리가 이런 게 한두 번이야?

translation.en: You get mad, say you're gonna leave,
translation.ko: 나한테 화나서 집 나간다고 난리 치다가도

translation.en: then we angry 69, and it's all good.
So let's unpack that duffel, grab some wet wipes, and--
Not this time. I'm done.
This isn't Jordan leaving in '93.
It's Jordan leaving in '98.
Good luck doing better than this!
[Diane] Gettin' dumped is the worst way to start off a Monday.
translation.ko: 아침부터 남편이 집을 나가다니 그야말로 최악의 월요일이네요

translation.en: Monday? Oh shit, it's Tuesday.
It's my nephew's birthday.
Happy birthday, sweetie. Whassup?
-Hi, Aunt Diane. -Say it.
-I can't talk. -Say it.
Whassup?
You're finally 18!
You know what I was doing when I was 18?
Jim Belushi. Ugh.
Played his goddamn harmonica the whole time.
Aunt Diane, I can't really talk--
Hey, no phones during dodgeball.
translation.ko: 어이! 누가 피구 중에 통화를 해?

translation.en: Can I pick the janitor?
No, you gotta pick Daniel.
Thank you, Barack Obama.
Okay, love you, sweetie.
What the hell?
-[bell jingles] -Hey, where's Stavros?
I beg your pardon?
Stavros.
Little Greek guy, unibrow, owns the coffee place next door.
translation.ko: 일자 눈썹에 키 작은 그리스 남자 바로 옆 카페 사장요

translation.en: Oh, we just bought that building.
Kreativ Jus is expanding.
By the way, I'm Feather, one of the wellness collaborators.
translation.ko: 그나저나 난 페더라고 해요 건강 파트너 중 한 명이죠

translation.en: Yeah, hi. Where's your alkaline water?
By the chia seeds.
If you hit the celery milk, you've gone too far.
translation.ko: 셀러리 우유가 보이면 너무 멀리 가신 거예요

translation.en: [chuckles] You know what I drink, sweetie?
Hose water, straight from Lake Michigan.
translation.ko: 그냥 호스에서 나오는 물요 미시간호 물이에요

translation.en: Lake Michigan has extremely high levels of E. coli.
translation.ko: 미시간호 물은 대장균 검출 수치가 높아요

translation.en: Don't be afraid of a little diarrhea, honey.
translation.ko: 설사 좀 하면 되지 뭘 그렇게 겁내요?

translation.en: Keeps you slim. Not that you gotta worry about it.
translation.ko: 살도 안 찌고 좋죠 아가씨는 걱정 없겠지만

translation.en: Sweet Christ, you are tight.
Anyhoo, Feather,
give me an extra-large half coffee, half cream, half Splendas
translation.ko: 커피, 크림, 스플렌다 반 넣어서 엑스트라 라지로 한 잔 주세요

translation.en: with crushed-up Excedrin on the rim.
It sounds like you're worried about inflammation.
Can I interest you in a CBD latte?
Reefer that don't get you high? Go scratch.
Girls, stop what you're doin'.
I need a Diane day. Kurt left me.
No. The day after y'all anniversary?
I know. What a jagbag.
Don't you do the mutual oral sex?
-And then the fight is over, right? -Like I didn't try that, Zuzana.
translation.ko: - 너희 부부는 그럼 싸움 끝나잖아 - 내가 안 하려고 했겠어, 주자나?

translation.en: I'm canceling all my appointment.
translation.ko: 오늘 예약 하나 있는데 다 취소할래

translation.en: Tina, get out your tarot cards. I need a reading.
translation.ko: 티나, 타로 카드 꺼내서 운세 좀 봐줘

translation.en: Zuzs, take off your Crocs. You're walkin' on my back.
translation.ko: 주즈스, 크록스 벗고 등 좀 밟아줘

translation.en: Anyway, we got a score?
-[static] -Oh shit, cable's out.
Zuzana, keep your Crocs on. You're goin' to the roof.
Diane, Diane, the new manager said no more Cubs games at work.
translation.ko: 다이앤, 새 매니저가 가게에서 시카고 컵스 경기 보지 말랬어

translation.en: Oh, the new manager.
You mean Mr. Fancy Pants from New York,
with his skinny little pizzas and his big, fat bagels?
translation.ko: 뭔 종잇장 같은 피자에 더럽게 큰 베이글 먹는 놈?

translation.en: Well, when New Dork Shitty gets here,
I'm gonna remind him that this is Chi City Sports Cuts and Clips.
translation.ko: 차이 시티 스포츠 컷츠 & 클립스가 어떤 곳인지 똑똑히 알려줘야겠네

translation.en: We were built on Chicago sports and the haircuts that defined 'em.
translation.ko: 우리 가게의 상징은 내로라하는 시카고 선수들 헤어스타일이야

translation.en: And in this place, on that screen,
when the Cubs are playin',
we watch 'em fuckin' play.
Diane, Gideon, our new manager.
Just got in from, how did you put it, New Dork Shitty?
translation.ko: 이 동네에 온 지 얼마 안 됐어요 뭐라고 하셨더라, 뉴욕 얼간이?

translation.en: Anyhoo, let's open up.
We did, 45 minutes ago.
Great. What'd I miss?
Well, I was telling Tina and Zuzana about the big renovation.
translation.ko: 대대적인 리모델링에 대해서 두 사람한테 설명하고 있었죠

translation.en: All these chairs? Gone.
The TVs will be showing silent music videos,
translation.ko: TV로는 차분한 느낌의 뮤직비디오를 틀 거고

translation.en: and we'll be going cashless.
Okay, but just keep in mind,
we're pretty old school at Chi City Sports Cuts and Clips--
-Borough. -What's that?
The salon has been renamed Borough.
It is our first location outside of New York.
translation.ko: 뉴욕 바깥에 지점을 내는 건 처음이죠

translation.en: That is so great.
What a fun day full of extreme changes.
translation.ko: 모든 게 새롭게 달라지는 너무나 즐거운 날이네요

translation.en: Now, if you'll excuse me for a sec, I'm gonna hit the head.
translation.ko: 잠깐만 실례해도 될까요? 화장실 좀 갔다 올게요

translation.en: -Give me the keys, motherfucker. -Please don't kill me! Take everything!
translation.ko: - 열쇠 내놔, 개새끼야 - 제발 살려만 주세요! 다 가져가세요 휴대폰이랑 지갑이에요

translation.en: Here's my phone. Here's my wallet!
-My PIN number's eight, four-- -[laughing]
Jesus, Diane. I do not like that.
translation.ko: 다이앤, 이런 장난 좀 치지 마요

translation.en: That's the risk you take coming into the big city, Mark.
translation.ko: 그러니까 대도시에 나올 때는 마음 단단히 먹고 와야죠, 마크

translation.en: -[laughs] She got you, Dad. -There's the birthday boy!
translation.ko: 한 방 먹었네요, 아빠 생일 주인공 여기 있네!

translation.en: Oh, I got you a present.
Tip it back. His boxers come off so you can see what Dave's packin'--
translation.ko: 술 마실 때마다 팬티가 벗겨져서 얼마나 튼실한지 볼 수 있는…

translation.en: Diane, he's 18.
-I know. He can legally drink. -That's not--
translation.ko: - 알아요, 술 마셔도 되는 나이! - 그게 아니라…

translation.en: This is actually apropos, Aunt Diane.
We're going to the Art Institute to see Hannah Black's video installation.
translation.ko: 해나 블랙의 비디오 아트를 보러 미술관에 가려고요

translation.en: It's a reimagining of all the Renaissance Masters.
But first, lunch at the Palmer House.
[verbalizing foghorn] Sucks.
Speakin' of which, where's my sister?
translation.ko: 그래서 말인데 내 구린 동생은 어디 있죠?

translation.en: Oh, um, she's-- Uh--
Well, what's goin' on with you, Diane?
Your hair looks… consistent.
Mark, I know when you're hiding something 'cause your milky skin gets pink.
translation.ko: 마크, 거짓말해 봤자 안 먹혀요 보드라운 피부가 붉어지셨네?

translation.en: -Okay, she's upstairs. -Mwah!
Well, if it isn't the Wicked Witch of the North Shore.
To what do I owe the pleasure?
We'll be in touch.
If you're thinkin' about rentin' out the second room, Bonnie,
you gotta tell me. I keep my wet clothes in there.
translation.ko: 나한테 말을 해줘야지 젖은 옷 두는 방인데!

translation.en: She's not moving in.
She stages apartments.
Diane, look, you know Daniel got into Stanford, right?
translation.ko: 다이앤, 대니얼이 요번에 스탠퍼드 붙은 거 알지?

translation.en: I know. And I hope my recommendation letter helped.
Yeah.
Besides being one of the most elite universities in the world,
it's also incredibly expensive.
So Mark and I have to offload some of our assets.
translation.ko: 그래서 우리 부부 자산 중에 일부를 좀 팔아야 하게 됐어

translation.en: English, please.
Oh my God, I'm selling the condo.
So I'm gonna have a new landlord?
You have to move out, Diane.
[gasps] What? How could you do this to me?
After all the work I put into this place?
translation.ko: 내가 이 아파트에 얼마나 공을 들였는데!

translation.en: The Van Halen Fatheads,
that poster of the Fridge on the fridge…
Maybe this'll be good for you.
It could be the kick in the pants you need.
What the hell does that mean?
I mean, don't you think it's time for you to reevaluate?
translation.ko: 내 말은 언니도 삶을 재정비할 때가 됐잖아

translation.en: Wait, where is the dishwasher?
I upgraded it to a kegerator.
-[phone chimes] -Oh. I can't get into this right now.
A homeless person just walked past the car, and Mark is nervous.
translation.ko: 노숙자가 차 옆으로 지나가서 마크가 무섭대

translation.en: A homeless person?
You mean, like what you just made me?
You have one week.
Oh, that's plenty of time.
I've gotten pregnant and un-pregnant in one week!
translation.ko: 나는 일주일 안에 애를 가졌다 말았다 했어!

translation.en: I am just fine, baby!
[Diane] So Kurt's gone, job is rocky,
and the apartment situation ain't lookin' good.
That's a three-peat but in a bad way.
Luckily, I can always count on my baby boy, Mikey.
translation.ko: 하지만 늘 믿을 수 있는 아들 마이키가 있어서 다행이에요

translation.en: Hi, Mikey!
Most mothers would be horrified if their son just got hit in the face
translation.ko: 보통은 아들 머리에 20kg짜리 캐리어가 날아오면 기겁하겠지만

translation.en: with a 48-pound Samsonite,
but my Mikey has the skull of a ram.
He's been hit in the head at every single Chicago sporting event.
translation.ko: 시카고에서 뭔 경기가 있을 때마다 꼭 뭔가에 머리를 얻어맞았거든요

translation.en: That huge, hard melon is why he's my only kid.
translation.ko: 머리통이 어찌나 크고 단단한지 둘째는 낳을 생각도 안 했어요

translation.en: Tore me apart comin' out.
-[grunts] -Hi, baby. I brought you rib tips.
translation.ko: 안녕, 아들! 너 먹으라고 갈비 가져왔어!

translation.en: Ma, I'm super busy.
Southwest keeps addin' these "wanna get aways,"
translation.ko: 사우스웨스트 항공 특가 티켓이 불티나게 팔려서요

translation.en: and all the bags fly free.
You know what would help? If I moved in with you for a bit.
translation.ko: 좋은 수가 있어 엄마랑 잠깐만 같이 지낼래?

translation.en: I could cook you breakfast gyros.
I'm sorry, Ma.
Dad already took the Murphy bed in the garage.
translation.ko: 차고에 있는 접이식 침대 이미 아빠가 차지했어요

translation.en: That slippery motherfucker.
I can't believe he would stoop to askin' his own child to bail him out.
translation.ko: 어떻게 그 나이 먹고도 자식한테 손을 벌리냐?

translation.en: What about the shed in back?
I would never let my mother live in a frickin' shed.
Besides, my buddy Anton's living there until his wife gets out of jail.
translation.ko: 친구 앤톤이 아내가 출소할 때까지 거기서 지내기로도 했고요

translation.en: You know what? You're right. I'm better than a shed.
translation.ko: 아들, 네 말이 맞아 이 몸께서 창고에서 잘 순 없지

translation.en: I should upgrade a little.
I love you, honey.
And remember, always lift with your back.
translation.ko: 짐을 나를 때는 등에 지는 거 잊지 말고!

translation.en: [grunts] Goddamn it! That is for sure over 50 pounds.
So I'd like somewhere with a pool. Above ground is preferred.
translation.ko: 수영장이 있으면 좋겠어요 땅 위에 세우는 식이 좋죠

translation.en: And I need a three-car garage
'cause I gotta park my Camaro horizontally.
Okay, that's a lot of amenities.
-[laptop chimes] -Oh, your credit report just came in.
-I don't think I can help you. -Why? What is it?
Negative 70.
Ah! It went up.
Maybe we need to reassess your criteria.
That's fine. I'm super flex.
translation.ko: 괜찮아요 나 그렇게 빡빡한 사람 아니에요

translation.en: If it's an in-ground pool, I'll deal.
I gotta run to work. I believe in you…
translation.ko: 난 이만 출근해야겠어요 당신만 믿어요, 성함이…

translation.en: -Carl. -Carl.
The cut looks great, honey.
Very Dennis Franz.
That'll be… 36 dollars?
Jesus, what a rip!
But totally worth it.
Do you take Apple Pay?
[laughs] Yeah, sure. One bushel of apples ought to do it.
Seriously, just scan my phone.
Ah, shit. Let me figure out this goddamn nerd pad.
translation.ko: 돌겠네, 괴짜들이나 쓰는 기계로 어떻게 결제를 하라는 말이야?

translation.en: -Oops. Wrong button. Maybe this-- -[thrash metal playing]
Okay, now that we've sanitized the perineum,
let's remove this ingrown hair.
Diane, turn this off.
-Shit. Sorry. Hold on. -[thrash metal cycles on and off]
And why are you watchin' this at work?
You said I couldn't watch the Cubs.
Turn it off, now.
Got it. So you hit "off."
Diane, you haven't had a client in your chair for two days,
translation.ko: 다이앤, 무려 이틀 동안 손님을 못 받았잖아요

translation.en: so I put you at the front counter, and somehow, that was worse.
translation.ko: 그래서 카운터나 보게 했더니 오히려 사고만 치네요!

translation.en: So back to the chair?
Diane, to be honest, I don't know where I can put you.
translation.ko: 다이앤, 솔직히 말하면 무슨 일을 맡겨야 하나 싶어요

translation.en: Maybe you just don't fit in here.
translation.ko: 우리 가게랑 안 맞는 것 같아요

translation.en: Oh, I see what's goin' on.
Well, that's too bad.
'Cause I really wanted to fit in here at Borough
'cause this place rocks.
Psych.
[Diane] Now, when a white person tells you they're from Chicago,
they're actually most likely from a suburb,
like where my sister Bonnie lives.
Hey. I'm talking to my Stanford roommate. Mom's in the kitchen.
translation.ko: 이모, 룸메랑 통화 중이에요 엄마는 부엌에 있어요

translation.en: Here, sweetie, kill this for me.
Oh, I don't want this.
Hi. Place looks great. Love the curtains and shit.
translation.ko: 안녕, 잘 해놓고 사네 커튼도 아주 기깔난다

translation.en: Listen, I gotta talk to you, in private.
Anything you say to me, you can say in front of Mark.
Okay. Hey, I can't stop queefing.
I'm gonna go charge the leaf blower.
Anyhooters, whaddya think about giving me an extension on the apartment?
translation.ko: 있잖아, 너희 아파트에서 조금만 더 살면 안 될까?

translation.en: Two, maybe three years.
Gotta get my freakin' ducks in a barrel.
Absolutely not.
[sighs] I thought it might come to this.
This is an Uno's Pizzeria platinum gold card.
It entitles the cardholder to free unlimited deep dish pizza for life.
translation.ko: 이 카드만 있으면 딥디시 피자를 평생 무제한 공짜로 먹을 수 있지

translation.en: I won it in a thong contest on Mancow's Morning Madhouse.
translation.ko: '맨카우의 모닝 매드하우스'에서 끈 비키니 대회 상품으로 받았어

translation.en: Obviously, the value of the card far exceeds the price of the rent,
translation.ko: 딱 봐도 이 카드의 가치가 집세보다 훨씬 비싸니까

translation.en: so we're gonna have to prorate the difference.
Wow, what a reasonable trade-off.
I rescind my offer.
Actually, while you're here, I do need you to sign this.
It just says that you will vacate the condo on the agreed-upon date.
Feel free to have your lawyer look it over.
Oh, sure. Yeah, I'll just run it by my lawyer.
And my stockbroker and my dentist.
Come on, Bonnie, you know I can't afford those luxuries.
translation.ko: 진짜 이러기야, 보니? 내 사정 뻔히 알면서

translation.en: Not everyone married a trust-fund baby.
Stop saying everyone who has a steady job is a trust-fund baby.
translation.ko: 언니는 직장만 꾸준히 다니면 금수저라고 부르더라?

translation.en: I'm not signing your stupid papers.
translation.ko: 이 뭣 같은 서류에 서명 안 해

translation.en: And to think, I almost gave you free deep dish for life.
translation.ko: 하마터면 평생 공짜로 피자 먹게 해줄 뻔했네

translation.en: Unlimited toppings, up to three. No premium meats.
translation.ko: 3개까진 토핑도 무제한이야 프리미엄 미트는 안 되지만

translation.en: Not available on weekend nights. Void where prohibited--
translation.ko: 주말 저녁엔 안 되고 일부 매장에서만…

translation.en: Diane, go home.
You hungry, kiddo?
My roommate's name is Thorn.
He's on a water polo scholarship,
and he says his girlfriend will be sleeping over a lot.
I shouldn't complain.
Stanford is one of the elite universities in the world.
You sound like your frickin' mom.
What are you really feeling?
Okay, I'll go first.
translation.ko: 좋아, 나 하는 거 잘 봐

translation.en: I know when you look at me, you think, "Damn, my aunt's got her shit together."
translation.ko: 나 보면 이런 생각 하지? '미친! 저 이모는 언제 정신 차려?'

translation.en: But if I'm being honest,
I'm kind of in a rebuilding year, and I don't know what's next for me.
translation.ko: 올해엔 모든 게 달라지고 있어 또 어떤 일이 닥칠지 모르겠다

translation.en: Now, you go.
[sighs] Well, I think I got so caught up in everybody wanting me to go to Stanford,
translation.ko: 뭐, 다들 스탠퍼드에 가라니까 거기에 휩쓸렸던 것 같아요

translation.en: I never asked myself if I wanted to go there.
translation.ko: 정말로 가고 싶은진 생각해 본 적도 없어요

translation.en: I felt the same way
when I went to Medieval Times for my third bachelorette party.
translation.ko: 그래서 세 번째 처녀 파티 때 중세 기사 디너쇼나 봤잖아

translation.en: Did you know all that shit's fake?
Yeah, we kept telling you.
[sighs] Why am I gonna move 2,000 miles away to find myself,
translation.ko: 뭐 하러 자아를 찾으러 3,200km나 떨어진 곳에 가죠?

translation.en: when I don't even know who I am here?
I know who you are. You're my amazing nephew.
translation.ko: 난 알아, 넌 나의 멋진 조카야

translation.en: You're cool and kind and talented. Hello!
translation.ko: 쿨하고 착하고 게다가 재능도 넘치지, 안 그래?

translation.en: With all your art stuff?
You're gonna be aces no matter where you end up.
translation.ko: 넌 어디서 뭘 하든 에이스가 될 거야

translation.en: You really like my artwork?
It's incredible, Daniel.
And I think art sucks.
-[jaunty ring tone plays] -Oh, it's my Realtor. Go for Diane.
Hello, Diane, great news.
Found a place, and it's in your price range.
Sweet Ditka's dick.
See, Daniel? Things do work out.
What neighborhood is it in?
Pilsen? Back of the Yards? Uptown? Downtown?
translation.ko: 필센? 백 오브 더 야즈? 업타운? 다운타운?

translation.en: Logan Square? Lincoln Square?
Lincoln Park? Garfield Park?
Morgan Park? Hyde Park? Would love a park.
translation.ko: 모건 파크? 하이드 파크? 공원 근처 좋죠

translation.en: It's in Hammond.
Hammond? But that's in…
[low-pitched and distorted] Indiana.
No!
Maybe Indiana isn't that bad.
Are you kiddin' me?
I'm gonna move to that shithole and become one of those invisible women
translation.ko: 그 똥통으로 이사했다가는 나도 투명 인간이 될 거야

translation.en: who eat Stouffer's creamed spinach soufflé by herself every night,
translation.ko: 매일 밤 혼자 청승맞게 인스턴트 시금치 수플레 크레이프나 먹다가

translation.en: until one day her cats turn on her and boom! I'm frickin' dead.
translation.ko: 키우던 고양이한테 당해서 붐! 골로 가는 거야

translation.en: And I'll never see you again because I'll be stuck in California
translation.ko: 전 고모도 다시는 못 보고 캘리포니아에 처박혀서는

translation.en: listening to Thorn not satisfying his girlfriend.
You know what?
You're leavin'. I'm leavin'. Fuck it.
Let's have the rager to end all ragers.
translation.ko: 뭐 있냐? 역대급 광란의 파티나 해보자

translation.en: One last chance for us to jam out with our clams out.
translation.ko: 마지막으로 미친 듯이 흔들어 보는 거야

translation.en: Yeah, I don't see how clam-jamming would fix this.
translation.ko: 미친 듯이 흔드는 건 좋은데 그런다고 상황이 나아져요?

translation.en: It won't. This world is filled with shit that we can't control.
translation.ko: 아니, 원래 인생은 엿같은 거야 우리 맘대로 되는 게 아니라고

translation.en: Your husband leaves, you get a jagbag of a boss,
translation.ko: 남편은 집 나가고 새 상사한테 갈굼당하고

translation.en: your whore sister kicks you out.
-Please don't call my mother that. -Daniel, it's like I always say.
translation.ko: - 우리 엄마 그렇게 부르지 마요 - 대니얼, 내가 늘 하는 말 있지?

translation.en: When life gives you lemons,
you turn that shit into Mike's Hard Lemonade.
[singer] Whoo!
Thanks for comin', sweetie.
Ooh, I'll take a hit of that.
Fuck Green Bay!
Bottoms up.
[inhales] My girls!
God bless you two. I'm gonna miss you both so much.
translation.ko: 둘에게 신의 축복이 있기를! 자기들 보고 싶어서 어쩌지?

translation.en: It won't be the same without you.
It'll be less loud, less smoky, and less fun.
[laughs] You said it.
Scottie Pippen. Ya made it.
You told me the other Bulls would be here.
I did. I did say that.
Find me later. I'm single again.
translation.ko: 이따가 둘이 볼래요? 나 이제 싱글이에요

translation.en: We can play "Just the Tip in with Pippen."
I know, right?
There he is. My handsome nephew.
What I wouldn't give to be 18 again and living down in the city.
translation.ko: 나도 다시 18살이 돼서 이 도시를 즐길 수 있으면 좋겠어

translation.en: Well, actually, I'm going to coll--
Whoa-whoa-whoa, Styx. Hold up, boys.
Can I get everyone's attention?
Tonight, we are celebratin' the end of an era.
translation.ko: 오늘 밤 우리는 한 시대의 끝을 기념하고 있어요

translation.en: As some of you may know,
this'll be the last rager thrown at this address.
translation.ko: 이곳에서의 광란의 파티는 오늘 밤이 마지막이랍니다

translation.en: -What? -No way.
Where are the other Bulls?
But more importantly,
we are also here to celebrate the start of a new era.
translation.ko: 한 시대의 시작을 기념하는 굉장히 뜻깊은 파티죠

translation.en: I'd like to give a toast to my nephew.
Daniel Whiddington, get your juicy little fanny up here.
translation.ko: 대니얼 위딩턴 그 탱글한 엉덩이 이리 가져와

translation.en: This is the best night of my life!
It's a miracle he turned out so good,
'cause his dad is a pussy and his mom is a dick.
translation.ko: 이 녀석 아빠는 쫄보고 엄마는 재수탱이거든요

translation.en: What da fuck?
-Mom? -Bonnie?
Put that goddamn beer stein down.
Oh, no, her Chicago accent's out.
-Did you tell her about the party? -No.
I tracked his phone, and I saw he was here.
That's an invasion of my privacy.
You, get your things.
You, fire escape, now.
Everything's okay.
Party's still on.
Styx, play "Come Sail Away."
Listen, Bonnie--
I should call the cops on you for getting my underage son drunk.
translation.ko: 미성년자 조카한테 술을 먹여? 경찰 불러도 언니는 할 말 없어

translation.en: The cops? Who do you think brought the nitrous?
Look at you.
You're chasing a party that ended 20 years ago.
translation.ko: 언제까지 파티 타령만 하게? 그 시절은 20년 전에 끝났어

translation.en: Why do you think Mom and Dad moved to Arizona?
Because the dry air is good for Dad's gout.
translation.ko: 그쪽 공기가 건조해서 아빠 통풍에 좋으니까

translation.en: No, it was to get away from you.
You're just like Chicago,
a huge mess whose best days are behind you.
translation.ko: 잘나가던 과거를 뒤로하고 이젠 엉망진창이 됐지

translation.en: I am just like Chicago!
Yeah, we ain't perfect.
The South Side is very screwed up.
North Side, a little better.
A lot of work and money has been put into it. That makes sense.
At least I don't worry about what everyone thinks
and pretend to be somethin' I'm not,
which is exactly what you're doin' to Daniel.
Well, guess what? He's goin' to college.
So worry about your own degenerate ass.
Don't talk to her like that way.
Daniel, you're drunk. Go downstairs and get in the car.
translation.ko: 대니얼! 완전히 취했네 당장 내려가서 차에 타

translation.en: You're not the boss of me anymore.
Get in the goddamn car.
Okay.
Nine a.m. tomorrow, you're out.
And clean this fucking place up.
translation.ko: 이 거지 소굴 깨끗이 청소해 놔

translation.en: Daniel, you okay?
No.
Is this how Aunt Diane feels every morning?
Yes, it is. And it's very sad.
Ugh. This is all because of her.
It is because of her.
Mom, we need to talk…
…in ten minutes.
Hey.
Hey.
I put the dishwasher back in.
[Bonnie] I see.
It's upside down, but I appreciate the effort.
I signed those forms you asked for.
Oh, you didn't sign it Tits McGee.
Nah, I used my real name.
You were right, Bon. I need to reevaluate.
translation.ko: 네 말이 맞아 난 삶을 재정비해야 해

translation.en: Anyhoo, Indiana's a short drive--
Diane, stop.
I don't know what happened here last night,
translation.ko: 어젯밤 여기서 무슨 일이 있었는지 몰라도

translation.en: but Daniel has decided he doesn't want to go to Stanford at this time.
Oh shit. You must be so pissed.
I am.
I-- I was. But I thought about it,
and I've never seen him so happy and confident.
translation.ko: 대니얼이 이렇게 확신하고 행복해하는 게 처음이더라

translation.en: And hungover.
But as Brené Brown says, when your child is happy, you need to support them.
translation.ko: 아무튼 브레네 브라운 말대로 애가 행복해하니 밀어줘야지

translation.en: Tits up, tits out. What are you gonna do?
I'll tell you what you're gonna do. You're gonna let him live here with you
translation.ko: 잘 들어 여기서 대니얼이랑 같이 살아

translation.en: while he takes a year to figure things out.
Whatever that means.
Go scratch. Does that mean--
We're not selling the place. Yet.
Whassup?
-Whassup? -Whassup?
Whassup?
-Whassup? -Whassup?
Stop! Daniel, you don't even know what that's from.
translation.ko: 그만해, 대니얼! 어디서 나온 말인지도 모르잖아

translation.en: Let's celebrate. First round on me!
translation.ko: 축하 파티 하자 첫 잔은 내가 쏜다!

translation.en: Oh shit, I don't have a job.
Actually, I might have an idea.
She's back.
Did you come back here to pick up the beer bong you left behind?
translation.ko: 맥주 깔때기 두고 갔던데 가지러 왔어요?

translation.en: Nope, I came in to cut hair.
Turns out a party invite is a great way to make a client list.
translation.ko: 파티에 초대했던 사람들을 고객으로 만드니 딱이네요

translation.en: Whaddya think, Gideon?
Chair three.
-[thrash metal playing] -Oh, my bad!
